org.zaproxy.zap.extension.httpsessions

Class ExtensionHttpSessions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionAdaptor
      • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.httpsessions.ExtensionHttpSessions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Extension, SessionChangedListener, HttpSenderListener, SiteMapListener

    public class ExtensionHttpSessions
extends ExtensionAdaptor
implements SessionChangedListener, SiteMapListener, HttpSenderListener
    The HttpSessions Extension handles the existing http sessions on the existing site. It allows the management and usage of multiple sessions per site and also handles the session tokens for each of them.

    Whenever referring to a particular site, the string that is identifying it is constructed from the site's URI and has to follow these rules:

    • no leading protocol (e.g. 'http'), colon (':') and double slashes ('//')
    • the port is added in the end after colon
    • lower-case
    An example of a method performing these changes on an URI is ScanPanel.cleanSiteName(String, boolean) .

      • isDefaultSessionToken

        public boolean isDefaultSessionToken(String token)
        Checks if a particular token is part of the default session tokens set by the user using the options panel. The default session tokens are valid for all sites. The check is being performed in a lower-case manner, as session tokens are case-insensitive.
        Parameters:
        token - the token
        Returns:
        true, if it is a default session token

      • isSessionToken

        public boolean isSessionToken(String site,
                     String token)
        Checks if a particular token is a session token name for a particular site. The check is being performed in a lower-case manner, as session tokens are case-insensitive.
        Parameters:
        site - the site. This parameter has to be formed as defined in the ExtensionHttpSessions class documentation.
        token - the token
        Returns:
        true, if it is session token

      • addHttpSessionToken

        public void addHttpSessionToken(String site,
                       String token)
        Adds a new session token for a particular site. The session tokens are case-insensitive, so this token will be added lower cased.
        Parameters:
        site - the site. This parameter has to be formed as defined in the ExtensionHttpSessions class documentation.
        token - the token

      • removeHttpSessionToken

        public void removeHttpSessionToken(String site,
                          String token)
        Removes a particular session token for a site.

        All the existing sessions are cleaned up:

        • if there are no more session tokens, all session are deleted
        • in every existing session, the value for the deleted token is removed
        • if there is a session with no values for the remaining session tokens, it is deleted
        • if, after deletion, there are duplicate sessions, they are merged

        Parameters:
        site - the site. This parameter has to be formed as defined in the ExtensionHttpSessions class documentation.
        token - the token

      • getHttpSessionTokens

        public final Set<String> getHttpSessionTokens(String site)
        Gets the set of session tokens for a particular site. The session tokens are case-insensitive and are returned lower-cased.

        The set of session tokens returned is read-only view of the internal session tokens and any modifications will result in UnsupportedOperationException. The current implementation of the set is using LinkedHashSet, thus iterating through the set is done in constant time.

        Parameters:
        site - the site. This parameter has to be formed as defined in the ExtensionHttpSessions class documentation.
        Returns:
        the read-only session tokens set, if any have been set, or null, if there are no session tokens for this site

      • getHttpSessionsPanel

      • getHttpSessionsSite

        protected HttpSessionsSite getHttpSessionsSite(String site)
        Gets the http sessions for a particular site. If it doesn't exist, it is created.
        Parameters:
        site - the site. This parameter has to be formed as defined in the ExtensionHttpSessions class documentation.
        Returns:
        the http sessions site container

      • getListenerOrder

        public int getListenerOrder()
        Description copied from interface: HttpSenderListener
        Gets the order of when this listener should be notified.

        The listeners are ordered in a natural order, the greater the order the later it will be notified.

        Note: If two or more listeners have the same order, the order that those listeners will be notified is undefined.

        Specified by:
        getListenerOrder in interface HttpSenderListener
        Returns:
        an int with the value of the order that this listener should be notified about

      • onHttpRequestSend

        public void onHttpRequestSend(HttpMessage msg,
                     int initiator)
        Description copied from interface: HttpSenderListener
        Notifies the listener that a new request was received from the client and is ready to be forwarded to the server.

        The HttpMessage msg can be modified (only the request should be modified). If the return value is true the message may be forwarded and the following listeners will be notified, if the value is false the message will not be forwarded and no more listeners will be notified.

        Note: In the presence of more than one listener there are no guarantees that:

        • the HttpMessage msg is equal to the one forwarded to the server, as the following listeners may modify it;
        • the message will really be forwarded to the server, even if the return value is true, as the following listeners may return false.
        • the int initiator as defined in the HttpSender class.

        Specified by:
        onHttpRequestSend in interface HttpSenderListener
        Parameters:
        msg - the HttpMessage that may be forwarded to the server

      • onHttpResponseReceive

        public void onHttpResponseReceive(HttpMessage msg,
                         int initiator)
        Description copied from interface: HttpSenderListener
        Notifies the listener that a new response was received from the server and is ready to be forwarded to the client.

        The HttpMessage msg can be modified (only the response should be modified). If the return value is true the message may be forwarded and the following listeners will be notified, if the value is false the message will not be forwarded and no more listeners will be notified.

        Note: In the presence of more than one listener there are no guarantees that:

        • the HttpMessage msg is equal to the one forwarded to the client, as the following listeners may modify it;
        • the message will really be forwarded to the client, even if the return value is true, as the following listeners may return false.
        • the int initiator as defined in the HttpSender class.

        Specified by:
        onHttpResponseReceive in interface HttpSenderListener
        Parameters:
        msg - the HttpMessage that may be forwarded to the client
